snippet: President Mohamed Morsi, whose recent tone and actions have reminded critics of his autocratic predecessor, set a referendum on a new constitution for Dec. 15.
abstract: Egyptian Pres Mohamed Morsi sets date of Dec 15 for national referendum on country's new constitution; Morsi's tone and actions have reminded critics of autocratic ways of his predecessor Hosni Mubarak, and have aroused debate about his commitment to democracy and pluralism at time when he and his Islamist allies dominate political life.
lead_paragraph: President Mohamed Morsi, whose recent tone and actions have reminded critics of his autocratic predecessor, set a referendum on a new constitution for Dec. 15.

headline.seo: In Egypt, a Clash Over Who’s a Threat to Democracy
headline.main: Amid Egypt’s Duel on Democracy, Morsi Calls for Vote
headline.print_headline: Amid Egypt’s Duel on Democracy, Vote Is Called

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
